jcr:content.jcr:title: United Nations Mission in Bosnia and Herzegovina

contentheadline.headline: United Nations Mission in Bosnia and Herzegovina

contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=January 2013}} The '''United Nations Mission in [[Bosnia and Herzegovina]]''' ('''UNMIBH''') was an [[international organization]] formed under the [[United Nations Security Council Resolution 1035]] on 21 December 1995. It completed its [[mandate (international law)|mandate]] on 31 December 2002, when it was succeeded by the [[European Union Police Mission in Bosnia and Herzegovina]]. From the UNIMBH website: :''UNMIBHâ€™s mandate is to contribute to the establishment of the rule of law in Bosnia and Herzegovina by assisting in reforming and restructuring the local police, assessing the functioning of the existing judicial system, and monitoring and auditing the performance of the police and others involved in the maintenance of law and order.'' ==External links== *[http://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unmibh/ Information at the United Nations website] {{DEFAULTSORT:United Nations Mission In Bosnia And Herzegovina}} [[Category:United Nations operations in the former Yugoslavia]] [[Category:History of Bosnia and Herzegovina]] {{UN-stub}}
